Entry.JapaneseText: いないってよ こいつ→<Unk17:382005>
ヘレンという娘がいなくなったと 騒いでる人がいましたが……
Entry.EnglishText: Someone was making a ruckus about how a girl called Helen disappeared...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうなったの でしょうかね……？
ガジュマの男の子？ さあ、ここらでは 見ませんでしたが……
Entry.EnglishText: A Gajuma boy? No idea, I didn't see one around here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、腹の立つ事が 多いのです。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been feeling a lot angry lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: でもこうやって体を動かせば、 イライラも全部、 吹き飛んでしまうのですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: But if I moved my body like this, I can feel my annoyance fading away.
Do you wanna try it out too?

Entry.JapaneseText: 仕事のうえでも ヒューマの方が少し 賃金が高いのです。
Entry.EnglishText: Humas earn more than I do while working.

Entry.JapaneseText: やってる仕事は同じなのに…… それが納得いかないのです。
Entry.EnglishText: I can't really accept this, why do they get more? We have the same job!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマにだって、 私のように頭脳労働に 向いてる者だっていますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Some Gajumas are more suited for mental work than others, like me.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうして、あなたたちヒューマは それをわかろうとしないのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Why can't you Humas understand that?

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍隊が来たからといって、 ミナールがガジュマにとって 住み心地よくなるわけではありません。
Entry.EnglishText: Just because the army came here in Minal doesn't mean that we Gajumas have it better.

Entry.JapaneseText: 以前よりも、なんとなく 息苦しいです……
Entry.EnglishText: Compared to before... It feels kind of suffocating.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何の音でしょう……？ まるで海が割れるような……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what that sound was...? It sounded like the sea broke open.

Entry.JapaneseText: しかしそんな…… 海が割れるなんて…… まさか……
Entry.EnglishText: The sea breaking open...? No way...

Entry.JapaneseText: 海の向こうからすごい音が…… どうしたのでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: Some loud noise suddenly came from the sea... I wonder what happened?

Entry.JapaneseText: 休みの日にはいつもこうやって 娘と遊ぶ時間を作っています。
Entry.EnglishText: I always take the time to play with my daughter on my days off.
Are you gonna ride a ship?

Entry.JapaneseText: 港はあっちの海が 見えてる方だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The harbor's just over there by the sea!

Entry.JapaneseText: 知りたい事があるの？ うちのパパに聞いてみれば？ 色んな事、知ってるよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Is there something you want to know? Ask my Papa! He knows a lot of things!

Entry.JapaneseText: パパはね、 お役所の三階で働いてるの。
Entry.EnglishText: He works at the third floor of the government office!

Entry.JapaneseText: 今日はパパはね、お仕事中。 お役所で働いてるんだよ？
Entry.EnglishText: My Papa's in the middle of work today! Did you know that he works in the government office?

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近のパパ、 ちょっとイライラしてて、 ちょっとコワイ……
Entry.EnglishText: You know, my Papa's been in a scary mood lately...

Entry.JapaneseText: 兵隊さんが来たけど、 私たちはいつもどおりだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Some soldiers came by earlier, but we're the same as usual.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一緒にミナール体操…… しない？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you want to do Minal exercises with us?

Entry.JapaneseText: 東のお空に、真っ黒な雲が 集まってるように見えるけど…… フキツね……
Entry.EnglishText: A bunch of ominous dark clouds started gathering in the east... Scary...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも今日はパパが一緒だし、 へいっちゃらだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: But, as long as I'm with Papa, I got nothing to be afraid of!

Entry.JapaneseText: これはね、 ミナール体操っていうの。 ……一緒にどう？
Entry.EnglishText: What am I doing? I'm doing Minal exercises! Wanna join?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマを野放しにする ガジュマも罪に問われるぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll have no choice but to charge you if you let those Huma out of your sight!
I'll be keeping an eye on you.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは家の中へ 入ってろ!!
それとも命令に逆らって 牢屋に放り込まれたいか？
Entry.EnglishText: I'll have you arrested if you don't!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの連中は 何を企んでるんだ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: What do you think you're doing, Huma!?

Entry.JapaneseText: こ、これは……おまえら ヒューマの仕業だな!?
ヒューマを信頼するな！ あの地鳴りもヒューマの 陰謀に違いない!!
Entry.EnglishText: Don't trust the Humas! I bet they're also behind these earthquakes!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマめ！ 一体、何を企んでやがる！
ガジュマを この世界から追い出そうったって そうはいかんぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: I won't let you Huma's chase Gajumas out of this world!

Entry.JapaneseText: 外は危険だ！ バイラスに気をつけるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: It's dangerous outside! Watch out for Veirases!

Entry.JapaneseText: この街は、 カレギア軍の監視下にある。 騒ぎを起こすんじゃないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: This town is under the Callegean Army's supervision. Don't you think of doing anything funny.

Entry.JapaneseText: 向こうに立ってる奴は 極端なヒューマ嫌いなんだそうだ。 ま、あんたにゃ関係ないか。
Entry.EnglishText: That servant over there really hates Humas... Well, it's none of your business anyway.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは外出禁止に なっている……
Entry.EnglishText: The Humas are currently in lockdown...

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、捕まりたくなかったら、 屋内に入ってた方が いいんじゃねえか？
Entry.EnglishText: Eh, if you don't want to get caught, then why don't you stay indoors for now.

Entry.JapaneseText: うぉぉ……な、なんだ、 このヘンな音……
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-Whoa... What was that sound just now...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 地震にしてはずいぶん長いし 様子も少し違う……何なんだ!?
Entry.EnglishText: Earthquakes have been growing longer and longer recently, it's-- Wh-What the--!?

Entry.JapaneseText: すごい地鳴りだったな。 冷や汗でびっちょりだ……
Entry.EnglishText: What a tremor, that made me break out in cold sweat!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……俺、この仕事、 向いてないのかも……
Entry.EnglishText: Do you think... I'm still suited for this job?

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺も、この状況は怖いさ…… でも、この国を守りたくて 兵士になったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm scared too... But I became a soldier to protect this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何があっても、 人々を守るぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: No matter what happens, I'll protect the people!

Entry.JapaneseText: 上からは、ヒューマに 厳しくするよう 言われてるんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: So the higher ups ordered us to be more stricter towards Humas...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、なんか不公平な 気がしてさ……
Entry.EnglishText: It kind of feels unfair though...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当、助かるよ。 これがまた重くてさ……
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks a lot, this thing's really heavy.

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんだよ、アイツ…… 急に……
お、俺たちは悪くねえぞ！ ただ、一緒にいる女が あまりにもアガーテ様にだな……
Entry.EnglishText: W-We did nothing wrong! It's just that the woman with you looked too much like Queen Agarte!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、あれ……？ フォルス……か……？
<voice:11000049>ふう、なんとか ゴマかせたネ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000049>Whew, we managed to weasel our way out of that one!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100004b>それより、これからどうする？ 港にあった船を奪うか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100004B>More importantly, what's our next move? Should we steal a ship?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100004c>下手に騒ぎを起こせば、 正規軍と戦う事になる。 無用な戦いは避けるべきだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100004C>If we cause a commotion, we'll have to fight the Callegean Army. We should avoid any unnecessary battles.
<voice:1100004D>Then what are we supposed to do?
<voice:1100004E>If it's a ship you need, then look no further!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000050>あっしは、トミッチ。 お見受けしたところ、 ダンナたち、ワケありのようで？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000050>I'm Tomich. I couldn't help but notice you nice fellas could use some assistance. Am I right?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000051>ボクたちの話、 盗み聞きしてたの？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000051>You mean, you were eavesdropping on us?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000052>めっそうもございません。 港で軍のやつらとモメてるのを見て、 もしかしたら船が要るんじゃないかと？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000052>I wouldn't put it that way. I just happened to witness your little spat with the port guard. Would I be right in assuming you need a boat?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000053>たいした洞察力だな。 何か船に乗るツテでもあるのか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000053>That's rather perceptive of you. Do you know of a way to help us?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000054>あっしはこの街で細々と 漁師をやってるんでさあ。 ですが、港が閉鎖されちまって、 海とにらめっこする毎日……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000054>I am but a humble fisherman who is trying to make ends meet. The port being closed doesn't exactly bring home the bacon.
<voice:11000055>...So you're after Gald. What's your price?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000056>さすが旦那、話が早い！ まあ、１０００ガルドって とこですかね。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000056>You get straight to the point! I like that! Let's see... 1000 Gald should do the trick.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000058>少々準備にお時間はいただきますが、 できましたら、ご案内しますぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000058>I'll need time to make the preparations, but if you pay upfront, I'll take you to my boat.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000059>なんかすっごく、 うさんくさいんですけど。
<voice:1100005b>……あっしはどっちでもいいんですよ。 船が必要なのはみなさんですから。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100005B>It makes no difference to me. You people aren't the only ones who need a boat, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100005c>もし船が必要なら、 街の入り口まで来てくださいな。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100005C>If you still need me, I'll be waiting at the entrance of town.
<voice:1100005E>...He was the fishiest fisherman I've ever met.
<voice:1100005F>It's not like we have any other options.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000063>ホラ、あの箱、 カレギア軍のマークが 描いてあるでしょ？ お届け先は……？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000063>It's got the Callegean Army insignia on it. The destination must be...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000065>だよね？ ついてったら、一緒に船に 乗り込めるんじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000065>It's gotta be! If we stick with that man, we might be able to board a ship, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000067>とりあえず、あのおじさんに 話を聞いてみようよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000067>Well, let's at least try talking to him for now.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000068>なんだね？ 今、ちょっと 取り込み中なんだが……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000068>What is it? I'm a little busy at the moment here...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000069>その箱、どこに 持っていくの？
<voice:1100006a>港に泊まっている軍の船に 運び込むのさ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100006A>It's gonna be loaded onto one of the army vessels docked at the port.
<voice:1100006B>Wow, that sounds like hard work for you.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100006c>ああ、いつもは 若いのにやらせるんだが、 あいにく休みでね。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100006C>Yeah, usually one of my young'uns would take care of it, but it's his day off.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100006d>この歳になると力仕事もきつくて、 さっきからこんな調子さ。 休み休みで仕事がちっともはかどらない。 困ったもんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100006D>When you get to be my age, this kind of labor really takes it outta you. I need to take a lot of breaks, so I don't make much progress. It's a real pain...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100006f>ねえねえ、ボクたちで 手伝ってあげない？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100006F>Hey, why don't we help him out?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000070>そんな事をしている ヒマはないはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000070>We don't have the time for that.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000071>だからさ、お手伝いを口実にさ、 船に乗り込むコトもできるじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000071>No, I mean we might be able to use helping him as an excuse to board a ship!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000072>だが、乗り込めたところで、 その先の保証はないし、 危険が大きい……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000072>Even if we make it onto a ship, there's no gurantee of plain sailing. It's a risky move.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000074>トミッチの船にするか、それとも、 あのおじさんの手伝いをして 船に乗り込むか。 それがモンダイだね。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000074>Should we take Tomichi's offer, or chance boarding a ship this way? What a head-scratcher!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000075>ねえ、おじさん。 ボクたちでよければ 手伝ってあげようか？
<voice:11000076>本当か？ うーん……ぼうずはともかく、 そっちの二人は力ありそうだな。 ……お願いしてもいいのか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000076>Really? Hmm... you're a little small for it, but those two look pretty strong. You really don't mind giving me a hand?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:00><scale:0120> ああ、運ぶよ ちょっと待ってくれ
<voice:11000078>いやあ、本当に助かる！ お礼に今晩、名物料理を ごちそうするよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000078>Wow, that's a weight off my back! To show my thanks, stop by my bar and I'll serve you Minal's local speciality! Free of charge!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>届け物の木箱を持ちました。
<voice:1100007a>ああ、いいけど、 日が暮れるまでには 運び込むように言われてるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100007A>Alright, but I need to get this to the ship before sunset.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100007b>手伝ってもらえるんなら 早めにお願いしたいんだが……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100007B>If you're going to help me, I'll need you sooner rather than later.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100007d>どうしたの？ トミッチの ところへ行ってみる？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100007D>What do you want to do? Should we see what happens with Tomich?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000bb>あれ、皆さん？ 急いで出ていったから、 もう街にいないと思ってたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000BB>Oh, it's you guys. You left in a hurry, I'd thought you'd be long gone from Minal by now.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000bc>港が封鎖されちゃっててさ。 船に乗れなくて困ってるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000BC>The port's been closed off. We can't catch a ship, so we're in a bind.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000bd>船はムリですよ。 もう一週間近く、 あんな状態なんですから。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000BD>Yeah, boats are a no-go. It's been like this for about a week now.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000be>海を渡りたいなら、他の港に 回ってみたらいかがですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000BE>If you want to travel by sea, why not find another port somewhere else?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000bf>やはり、 その方法しかないか……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000BF>That may be our only choice after all...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000c2>それが…… まだ、眠ったままです。
<voice:110000c3>そうか……すまんが、 <Annie>の事を頼む。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000C3>I see... Sorry, but I'm counting on you.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000c4>はい、まかせてください!! あの……ところで……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000C4>Of course, please leave it to us! Um, by the way...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000c6>はい。あの……そちらの、 コワイ顔をしたあなた……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000C6>Uh, well... You over there, with the scary face...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000ca>す、すいません……！ ……もしかしてあなた、 <Veigue>さんじゃありませんか？
<voice:110000cc>やっぱり、そうなんですね？ そうじゃないかと思ってたんです。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000CC>Ah, so it is you! I thought it might be.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000cd>前に先生のところに来た患者さんが あなたの事を言ってたんですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000CD>Earlier, a patient who came to see the Doc spoke about you.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000ce>背が高くて、怖い顔してて、 大きな剣を持った髪の長い、 <Veigue>って名前のヒューマが 来るかもしれないって。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000CE>She said a tall, long-haired Huma named <Veigue> with a sword and a scary face might come here.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000d0>名前はよく知らないんですけど、 ちょうどあなたと同じ歳くらいの ヒューマの女の人でした。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000D0>I'm afraid I don't know her name, but she was a Huma girl very close to your age.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000d3>え……さあ……詳しい話は 先生に聞いてみないと……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:110000D3>Well...I'm not too sure. If you want details you'll have to ask the Doc.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:110000d4>先生はまだ宿屋にいるんだな？
<voice:11000118>先生、ミーシャは 見つかった？
<voice:11000119>いいえ…… どこにもいないの。
<voice:1100011a>何をそんなに 慌てているんですか？
<voice:1100011b>お願い…… ミーシャを助けて……
<voice:1100011c>早く見つけて落ち着かせなければ、 ミーシャは……ミーシャの フォルスが暴走してしまうわ!!
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100011C>If we don't find him soon and calm him down, his...his Force will go berserk!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100011e>そうよ。 あの子も<Blue>ラドラスの落日<White>で 覚醒した能力者のひとり……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100011E>Yes. That child was one of many whose power awakened during the <Blue>Dusk of Ladras<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100011f>でも、どうして今ごろ 暴走しちゃうの？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100011F>But why would he lose control of it now?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000120><Annie>が言った言葉…… ミーシャはあれと同じ事を、 前にも言われた事があるのよ。 それも、大好きなお母さんに……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000120>What <Annie> said to him... Such words have been directed at him once before. Sadly, they came from his own mother.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000122>ミーシャのフォルスが発現した時、 フォルスに驚いたお母さんは、思わず 「来ないで」と言ってしまった。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000122>When Misha's Force awakened, his mother was petrified and said told him to "stay away", just like <Annie> did.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000124>そのショックで、 ミーシャのフォルスは暴走を始めた…… 偶然にも私がその場に居合わせて、 なんとか暴走は止めたけど。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000124>That's what triggered his Force outburst. I happened to witness it at the time and somehow managed to calm him.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000125>結局、それが原因で、あの子は お母さんに見捨てられるような 形になってしまったの。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000125>In the end, the poor child was completely abandoned by his mother.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000126>だから私はあの子を引き取って、 仕事の手伝いをしてもらう事に したのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000126>So I decided to take him in, and then he became my assistant.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000128>暴走の一件以来、あの子は 周りからあまり好意的とは いえない扱いを受けて来たわ。 それでも、あの子はがんばった。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000128>After that incident, Misha was not looked fondly upon by the people around here. But even still, he perseveres and tries his best.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000129>あれ以来、暴走もなく、 ようやく周りもあの子を 受け入れてくれるように なってきてたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000129>Since then, he hasn't lost control of his Force once, and people have finally started to accept him.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100012a>ここでまた暴走を 起こしてしまったら、 あの子はどうなるの……!?
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100012A>If he has another Force outburst after all this time, I don't even want to think about what would happen to him!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100012d>ゴメンね、<Veigue>。 先を急ぎたいのはわかるけど、 ボク、ミーシャを放っとけないヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100012D>Sorry, <Veigue>. I know you want to move on from here, but I can't leave Misha like this.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100012f>フォルスの暴走で、 ボクは記憶を失った。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100012F>I lost my memory when my Force went berserk.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000130>お父さんの事も、お母さんの事も、 みんな忘れちゃったけど…… ボクも、ミーシャみたいに 見放されたのかもしれない……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000130>My mom, my dad... I don't remember anyone. I could have been abandoned by them like Misha was.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000131>……だから、ミーシャの事、 ひとごとには思えないんだヨ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000131>I relate to Misha. This is my problem too.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000132><Veigue>…… おまえにも覚えはないか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000132><Veigue>... Have you forgotten what it was like?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000134>フォルスの暴走に クレアさんを巻き込んだ時、 周りの反応はどうだった？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000134>When you lost control of your Force and trapped Claire in ice, how did those around you react?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:11000135>おじさんとおばさんが オレをかばってくれなければ…… 今ごろは……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:11000135>If my aunt and uncle hadn't covered for me, I'd probably have been...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:1100013b>まだ、どっちの方角かは わからないけど、 フォルスの高まりを感じるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:1100013B>I still don't know which direction it's coming from, but I can feel a strong Force presence nearby.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000003>みなさん、やめてください！ どうして毎日こんな風に ケンカしなくちゃいけないんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000003>Everyone, please just stop! Why is it necessary for you to fight like this day in and day out!?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000004>ケガ人ばかり出して、 いい加減になさい！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000004>This does nothing but get people hurt! Get a hold of yourselves at once!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000009>え、ええ…… 私は大丈夫だけど……
<voice:3b00000a>あ、おまえ……！ まさかガジュマの味方を するわけじゃないだろうな？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B00000A>Why, you...! Don't tell me you've taken the side of the Gajuma!?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b00000b>どっちの味方でもない。 オレは、種族間のばかげた 争いを止めたいだけだ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B00000B>I'm not on any side. I just want to put an end to this absurd, ceaseless fighting!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b00000d>この裏切り者！ おまえは引っ込んでろ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B00000D>You're a damn traitor! You have no right to interfere!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b00000e>いいから、ガジュマどもを この街から追い出しちまおうぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B00000E>You know what? It doesn't matter. Let's just chase these Gajuma out of town!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000010>大変だ！ 軍だ！ 軍が来たぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000010>Bad news, everyone! It's the army! The army is here!

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000011>軍!? 軍が何しに 来たんだー!?
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000011>The army? What are they doing here!?
<voice:3B000012>So the Callegean Army has arrived as well...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000013>ガジュマとヒューマの騒乱を 聞きつけて来たんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000013>They must be here because they were notified of the fighting.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000014>……とりあえず、しばらくは 静かになりそうね。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000014>Well in any case, at least things should calm down for the time being.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000015>ここで立ち話もなんだし、 宿屋へ行きましょう。 お茶ぐらいごちそうするわ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000015>We should talk more at the inn instead of standing around here. I'll treat you all to some tea.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000049>おい、ヒューマは外出禁止だ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000049>Hey! Huma are forbidden from wandering outside.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b00004a>人を探しているんだ。 どいてくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B00004A>We're looking for someone. Get out of the way.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b00004c>お願いします。 とても大切な人なんです。
<voice:3b00004d>……おやっ？ あんた…… アガーテ様に似てるような 気がするなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B00004D>...Oh? You there. You look an awful lot like Queen Agarte...

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b00004f>なぁ、この娘…… アガーテ様に似てると 思わないか？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B00004F>Doesn't this girl bear a strong resemblance to Her Majesty?

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000050>確かに良く似てる。 ああ……アガーテ様だ。
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000050>She does look a lot like her. Yeah...their faces are nearly identical.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000051>私は…… 私はアガーテ様じゃ ありません……
<voice:3b000052>わかってるよ。 アガーテ様が、おまえたちなんかと こんなところにいるはずがないだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000052>You think we don't know that? She'd never be in a place like this, and certainly not with a group like you.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000053>それにしても、そっくりだよなぁ。 案外、本物だったりしてな？
Entry.EnglishText: <voice:3B000053>Still, the resemblance is uncanny. Almost makes me wonder if she IS the real thing.

Entry.JapaneseText: <voice:3b000054>……違う…… アガーテじゃない……
<voice:3b000058>……アガーテじゃない…… クレアだ……
<voice:3b00005b>これはクレアだ…… クレアだ……クレアだ……！
<voice:3b00005e>……あぁぁぁ…… ……うわぁぁぁぁぁぁッ!!
<voice:3b000060>まさか、あれは……!? みんな、<Veigue>を追うんだ!!
<speed:00><scale:0140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:00><scale:0140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
